instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1465: What is A1465? A1465 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2924, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00164, 820-3208, 820-3435..
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with messed up LIO connector
threads.message:
This board had water damage. It started working fine after letting it enjoy my UC, but the magsafe light stayed off. Took me some time before I figured out that one of the pins in the LIO connector had corroded itself in half. Its the <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> pin, so that explains the missing light.
I've considered running a jumper over to the magsafe board, but that would suck if someone had to take the board out again, plus some other pins aren't looking pristine either.
I have some donor boards underway, but provided they have good connectors on there, the question is if those can be removed without destroying them. I was thinking wrapping them in tin foil tape to keep the heat away from the plastic, but not sure if that would do it. Anyone have experience with this or know if these can be bought seperately? I found some in the US on ebay: [url]http://www.ebay.nl/itm/Lot-of-NEW-USB-I-O-Power-Board-Connector-for-MacBook-Air-11-<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1465</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>-2015/232193722395?hash=item360fd3081b:m:mM1U5_TpVhg3yBoFGYFHyiQ[/url], but shipping costs are ridiculous.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with messed up LIO connector
threads.message: Just jumper the 3V42 from the board to the IO board. I have done it several times.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with messed up LIO connector
threads.message: I ran a jumper, board fixed. :)
